intro: Psychotria robertii, commonly known as the "Coca plant" or "Yareta," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, white to pale green flowers. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often growing in rocky or alpine conditions. Psychotria robertii is notable for its ecological importance and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
